summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August-September 2019 discussing investigative updates on the Epstein case. It covers coordination on interviews, phone analysis, and strategy regarding co-conspirators, victims, and media reporting. It references the closure of a preliminary obstruction investigation and preparations for an upcoming court hearing.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as a co-conspirator whose location and role have been the subject of sustained media reporting. The email advises the team is currently focused on charges for a different co-conspirator.

events.title: Interview regarding document shredding
events.description: An interview of a complaint regarding document shredding was conducted. It did not support federal criminal activity, specifically Obstruction of Justice.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview
events.description: A victim is scheduled to be interviewed late in the morning.

events.title: Daily HQ conference call established
events.description: Headquarters requests daily updates via a conference call at 1530, driven by DOJ. The email discusses strategy for these calls.

keyFacts: A preliminary investigation (Squad C4 Obstruction Investigation 72-NY-3157147) into document shredding was closed on 8/28/19 as it did not support federal criminal activity.
The FBI team was focused on charges for a co-conspirator other than Maxwell, based on the volume and quality of evidence, but was engaged with Counsel for all co-conspirators.
Investigative steps included ongoing cell phone analysis, a motel subpoena (results inconclusive), and interviews of 14 MCC Corrections Officers.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and pressure from HQ/DOJ for daily updates, with awareness that information would be pushed to senior leadership ('the seventh floor').
The team was preparing for a significant court hearing on a Tuesday (likely early September 2019), coordinating victim attendance.
